intro: Hypoestes cernua, commonly known as the "Snowflake" or "Trailing Hypoestes," is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and a bluish-green hue. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Hypoestes cernua is often used in hanging baskets or as ground cover due to its trailing habit and ornamental foliage.
